customUndo.description:
Whether we shall use custom undo/redo support instead of the native
browser support. By default, we only enable customUndo for IE, as it
has broken native undo/redo support. Note: the implementation does
support other browsers which have W3C DOM2 Range API implemented.

editActionInterval.description:
When using customUndo, not every keystroke will be saved as a step.
Instead typing (including delete) will be grouped together: after
a user stops typing for editActionInterval seconds, a step will be
saved; if a user resume typing within editActionInterval seconds,
the timeout will be restarted. By default, editActionInterval is 3
seconds.
end of custom undo/redo support

onLoadDeferred.description: Deferred which is fired when the editor finishes loading

isTabIndent.description:
Make tab key and shift-tab indent and outdent rather than navigating.
Caution: sing this makes web pages inaccessible to users unable to use a mouse.

disableSpellCheck.description:
When true, disables the browser's native spell checking, if supported.
Works only in Firefox.

disabled.description: The editor is disabled; the text cannot be changed.

description.value: This widget provides basic WYSIWYG editing features, based on the browser's underlying rich text editing capability, accompanied by a toolbar (dijit.Toolbar). A plugin model is available to extend the editor's capabilities as well as the the options available in the toolbar. Content generation may vary across browsers, and clipboard operations may have different results, to name a few limitations. Note: this widget should not be used with the HTML <TEXTAREA> tag -- see dijit/_editor/RichText for details.
